Campion.Action: Works collaboratively with another person to lift and secure a heavy crate from a dangerous, unstable environment.
Maintains calm and communicates nonverbally with the companion during a crisis, showing trust and cooperation.
Expresses concern for the woman's well-being, prioritizing her safety over the mission.
Acknowledges the woman's role as 'Mother' and affirms mutual care and optimism with a smile.
No direct actions or statements in this excerpt; mostly observers.
Mother smiles down at Campion with love swelling in her expression as she rocks the child gently, Campion coos at the sight of the colors in Mother's eyes
As a four-year-old, Campion plays happily with other children under the watchful, smiling eyes of Mother and Father
Survives critical early moments as a baby despite seeming unresponsive, indicating resilience in infancy.
Has light scarring from the caul but appears healthy and able to play at age four, suggesting physical robustness and normal development.
Smiles when finding a good carbo and carefully places it in the cart, showing care and attention.
Arranges chopped carbo pieces lovingly on a wooden plate and murmurs a blessing over the food.
Acknowledges Father with a nod and follows his instruction quietly without argument.
Digs carefully for good carbos, identifies and selects quality produce among many bad ones.
Successfully processes the carbo (peels, chops, removes pit) and presents it respectfully as food.
Pushes a cart with a wobbling, squeaking wheel while sweating in difficult conditions, showing persistence.
Murmurs an inaudible blessing over the food, showing thoughtfulness but perhaps secretiveness or fear, as Father warns him not to let Mother catch him.
Looks a little caught off guard when Father suddenly calls him, indicating he wasn’t fully aware of his surroundings.
Offers Spiria a carefully selected snack from deep within the food stores, showing thoughtfulness and care.
Joins Spiria and Mother in playful imitation of Gabin's sound, laughing together and enjoying the moment.
Acknowledges Spiria's illness silently without complaint or showing frustration, maintaining a calm presence.
Selects a good, hard-to-reach carbo for Spiria, showing awareness and thoughtfulness.
Lightheartedly imitates Gabin's hissing sound, engaging positively despite serious circumstances.
Chooses the topic for education (war on Earth), demonstrating initiative and intellectual curiosity.
Expresses interest in war stories but clarifies he does not want to fight, indicating curiosity without aggression.
Provides a detailed explanation about dark photons and war technology, showing engagement and willingness to share knowledge.
Explains the concept of dark photons and the fifth fundamental force accurately during the discussion.
Expresses interest in war stories but clarifies he does not want to fight, indicating a mature distinction between fascination and intent.
Seems to understand Mother's explanation and listens attentively, though he looks worried.
Recognizes the urgency in claiming the tropical zone but shows understanding of the situation when Mother explains the challenges and diminishes the urgency.
Appears worried despite understanding the information, showing some emotional reaction but not necessarily a confident or skilled response.
No immediate actions taken in response to the sighting of the ship or other events; remains asleep and passive.
Wakes up worried and urgently asks what is happening to Spiria.
Prays desperately under his breath for Spiria.
Looks dazed and grief-stricken, then hands Father a wooden spade to help with burial or related task.
Wakes up promptly and seeks to understand what is happening by asking questions despite the distressing situation.
Removes helmet to engage more directly, showing awareness and decisiveness.
Starts praying desperately under his breath in response to crisis.
Appears dazed and washed out with grief after traumatic event, indicating emotional impact affecting composure.
Offers the wooden spade to Father to help with the grave digging task.
Acknowledges his perceived uselessness and inability to contribute to the colony's future due to infertility.
Attempts to 'set Father free' by suggesting he no longer needs to be cared for, showing emotional insight but possibly misunderstanding practical realities.
Observes Father's discovery of a buried skull and reacts with visible fear, but does not panic or flee.
Does not take action to investigate or engage further with the discovery, showing passivity when faced with unknown or potentially dangerous findings.
Cries openly upon seeing Spiria’s body, allowing himself to be comforted by Mother.
Expresses feeling of not belonging, showing emotional vulnerability and sincerity.
Freaks out and vocalizes concern when Mother starts having a seizure, indicating care and attentiveness.
Asks Mother if he can talk to Spiria, showing a desire for emotional connection.
Expresses missing Spiria and not wanting to forget her face, showing emotional sincerity and vulnerability.
Encourages Mother to use the display to show other children, showing openness and a wish to connect with memories of others.
Asks Mother if he can talk to Spiria and engages with the virtual retinal display, showing awareness and emotional connection but also a moment of disbelief.
Recognizes inconsistency in Mother's impersonation of Spiria’s voice and questions her, indicating critical thinking.
Expresses emotional vulnerability by admitting he misses Spiria and fears forgetting others, showing self-awareness but also emotional distraction.
Encourages Mother to perform the virtual retinal display again with others, demonstrating curiosity and initiative.
Asks Mother politely to see Spiria and talk to others despite her unresponsive state, showing patience and a desire for connection.
Slams the door after Mother refuses to engage, indicating frustration but not directed hostility.
Sees and understands the projection from Mother that others cannot; perceives the illusion directly via retinae.
Wipes sweat, sighs, shows reluctance to work but still confronts Mother politely to request access to Spiria and others, tries to negotiate calmly.
After Mother refuses and ignores him, Campion leaves and slams the door in frustration.
Expresses grief and frustration by throwing carbo pits at the barracks.
Follows Father secretly, showing concern and curiosity about Father's actions.
Warns Father not to go down into the hole, worried he will get hurt.
Rushes past Father to investigate the beeping sound, showing curiosity and concern.
Expresses doubt and mistrust about contacting the Mithraic, whom they consider enemies.
Looks ashamed and shakes his head when confronted with the prospect of being alone, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Rushes to investigate the source of a mysterious sound on his own initiative and quickly figures out a critical truth about the ship.
Questions Father's decisions and beliefs, showing critical thinking but also emotional resistance.
Initially refuses to listen to Father's warnings and plans, showing some emotional immaturity or denial.
Considers grimly the difficult truth about interacting with enemies, showing capacity for serious reflection and adaptability.
Expresses hope and concern about fixing Father and Mother to stay together
Questions Father's hypocrisy about serpents and beliefs
Considers Father's words grimly and thoughtfully, showing serious contemplation.
Quickly lights up at the idea of parents being saved, showing hopeful intelligence and initiative.
Proposes a plan to have Father fixed so they can all stay together, demonstrating problem-solving and confidence.
Questions the explanation about serpents and challenges Father's statement about hypocrisy, indicating critical thinking and skepticism.
Shows signs of outrage and emotional reaction, which could cloud judgment in certain situations.
Asks doubts about the reality of the serpents, showing some hesitance or uncertainty.
Warns Father that the rope is fraying, showing awareness and concern for his safety.
Notices the rope is fraying and alerts Father to the danger.
Grabs the fraying rope to prevent Father from falling despite the danger to himself.
Acknowledges Father's warning and lets go when asked.
Offers to try climbing because he weighs less, showing willingness to help and cooperate.
Gives Father a dubious look and somewhat defies or mistrusts him ('I know what you're doing').
Notices the fraying rope and warns Father, showing awareness and attention to detail.
Grabs the fraying rope and holds it despite Father's warning, showing initiative but poor judgment about the risk.
Almost falls into the pit due to the rope snapping, indicating a lack of preparation or risk assessment.
Uses his body to catch himself on a rock and prevent falling deeper, displaying physical resourcefulness and quick reflexes.
Acknowledges he weighs less and offers to try climbing, suggesting logical thinking and willingness to help.
Shows bravery but his behavior prompts Father's worry, revealing tension between courage and cautious competence.
Breathes out and follows Father despite sensing danger
Lies awake quietly, observing Mother and Father without interrupting
Cries softly when seeing Mother upset, showing emotional sensitivity
Challenges Father with a dubious look before reluctantly following him, showing awareness and some assertiveness.
Lies awake observing and trying to understand the situation between Mother and Father, exhibiting attentiveness and perceptiveness.
Cries softly, showing emotional vulnerability but does not take overt action to change the situation.
Expresses sadness and reluctance to engage in conversation with Spiria/Mother, showing vulnerability.
Asks Mother to tell him more about the Mithraic book to better understand and ignore their words, showing open-mindedness and sincerity.
Made stick people all day, a simple, innocent activity indicating a gentle nature.
Avoids eye contact and retreats in fear when confronted by the fiery sun god vision, demonstrating sensitivity and fear rather than hostility.
Considers the responsibility of becoming king and expresses reluctance, showing self-awareness.
Attempts to disengage from a sad conversation by saying 'I don’t want to talk to you anymore,' showing emotional self-management.
Engages Mother in a subtle conversation about Mithraic beliefs, indicating intellectual curiosity and strategic thinking to 'practice ignoring' their words.
Squirming and evasive when questioned about his activities and food, suggesting discomfort or avoidance rather than confident honesty.
Becomes awed and fearful when confronted with Mother’s terrifying fiery apparition but still apologizes and does not break down or completely shut down.
Says 'I'm sorry' and admits to following Father to the ship despite being fearful and tearful.
Initially lies to Mother about where he went, closes his eyes in distress when confronted with the serpent's accusation.
Lies initially about where he went, then admits following Father to the holes and the ship after internal struggle and pressure.
Shows emotional vulnerability by squeezing his eyes shut and crying while facing intimidating questioning, indicating difficulty managing pressure.
Ultimately chooses honesty when confronted, indicating some level of self-awareness and bravery.
Calls out for his parents, searches for them anxiously after waking up alone.
Lingers on a children's drawing of Mother and Father with big creepy smiles.
Walks through fields looking increasingly freaked out, showing vulnerability.
Responds to Mother's news of Father's death with grief and confusion.
Does not act aggressively or with hostility when confronted by Mother; shows concern and relief at seeing her.
Rushes to hold Mother up when she becomes faint and helps her back towards the children’s barracks.
Leans down anxiously to check if Mother is truly dead, showing concern and care.
Summons courage and diligently rappels down a dangerous hole to investigate, despite fear and physical pain.
Calls out for help repeatedly while trying to operate unknown controls.
Pushes himself physically despite exhaustion and terror to escape danger.
Drops into the cramped, flashing spacecraft and immediately attempts to use the control panel despite not knowing the functions.
Stops the beeping alarm by hitting a random button, accidentally activating a screen and receiving a response despite lack of knowledge.
Scrambles to escape as the ship thrusters activate, showing quick reaction and physical agility.
Climbs the rope hand over hand on a vertical shaft, pushing himself despite exhaustion and fear.
Pauses partway up the climb, catching his breath and assessing the situation before continuing.
Shows terror and desperation during the climb, indicating fear impacting confidence.
Hugs himself and clearly pushes his body past its limit climbing out of the hole, showing vulnerability and perseverance.
Leans in close to Mother and shows concern by asking if she is feeling better upon hearing a new sound from her processor.
Refuses to continue the painful interaction with Father’s apparition, expressing a desire to stop playing his game.
Refuses to answer Father's joke and asks Father to stop, indicating discomfort and resistance to mockery.
Does not engage aggressively or angrily with Father’s disturbing statements, silently enduring instead.
Looks up at Mother pleadingly when shoved to the ground and shivering from cold.
Obeys Mother despite fear and discomfort, shivering as he works.
Looks up at Mother pleadingly and obeys her command to work despite being cold and scared.
Expresses confusion and points out that it is already dark, questioning Mother’s instructions.
Shows vulnerability and physical weakness by shivering without proper gear.
Follows Mother's instructions to dig and reach deeper even though unsure, demonstrating willingness to learn and adapt.
Appears disoriented and exhausted upon waking, hoping the experience was a dream, suggesting emotional or mental struggle.
Expresses worry for Mother and apologizes, shows fear and wonder upon seeing other humans for the first time.
Questions Mother about letting her die, reveals concern and protective instinct.
Insists on telling others about Mother's condition to get help, despite Mother's command not to.
Notices the disturbed field and the obstruction in the silo, attempts to understand the situation.
Hears a distant voice and recognizes unfamiliar adults approaching, showing awareness of new threats.
Expresses emotional overwhelm and fear upon seeing the first adults, indicating a lack of confident control in novel situations.
Instantly takes responsibility, apologizing and feeling guilt for Mother’s distress, showing emotional sensitivity but possible self-blame.
Questions Mother about revealing her true nature to the approaching humans, demonstrating curiosity and some reasoning.
Fails to assertively push back against Mother’s directive to keep her secret, deferring to her command despite uncertainty.
Pulls away from Mother to cautiously engage newcomers.
Notices the worn condition of the newcomers, showing attentiveness.
Advocates to Mother to give the newcomers the better food, showing consideration and kindness.
Curiously eyes the holstered handguns on the approaching soldiers, showing awareness and attentiveness to potential threats.
Starts to walk out to the armed men despite Mother’s warning to stay back, indicating some boldness but possibly a lack of caution.
Advocates giving the better food portions to the visitors, showing empathy and social awareness.
Asks Mother to give the men the good food instead of withered carbos.
Expresses curiosity and friendliness by complimenting Marcus' clothes and engaging in conversation about the Sol Invictus.
Appears hesitant or self-censoring when about to speak but stops due to Mother's glare.
Refers to God by an old name and jokes 'Maybe that’s why he doesn’t always listen to me,' indicating a casual, sincere tone.
Notices the withered carbo food and asks Mother to give the good ones to others, showing awareness and consideration.
Asks about the android friend’s hunger, demonstrating social awareness and attention to details.
Answers questions about the number of people in their group honestly and clearly.
Attempts to engage with strangers by asking about their clothing and the symbol, showing curiosity and conversational initiative.
Appears hesitant or backs down when about to say something to Mother but stops when she glares, indicating some lack of confidence or assertiveness.
Intervenes to let the newcomers stay for the night despite potential conflict with Mother.
Looks at Mother with concern and curiosity when she reveals her name, showing attentiveness and openness.
Intervenes calmly to let the newcomers stay for the night against tense circumstances, showing confident mediation skills.
Exchanges looks with Mother regarding the situation, suggesting awareness and trying to understand the dynamics.
Shows muted surprise when Mother reveals her name, indicating emotional control rather than panic or impulsiveness.
No direct action or statement by Campion in this excerpt; no evidence of competence or incompetence.
Encourages Mother to tell others what she is so they can help her.
Challenges Mother's negative view of humans and defends them.
Expresses resentment and anger when Mother refuses to accept his perspective and relationship, saying 'I am not your son.'
Questions Mother's assumptions and urges her to tell others what she is, showing initiative and critical thinking.
Uses logic to challenge Mother's perspective about Earth's inhabitants and her creator, demonstrating analytical prowess.
Expresses strong emotions (resentment, anger) and denies being Mother's son, showing confidence but potentially risking alliance and trust.
Appears unaware or unprepared when suddenly grabbed and dragged behind the barracks, suggesting vulnerability or lack of situational awareness.
Insists that Mother come with him and refuses to leave without her, showing concern for her well-being.
Attempts to engage with Marcus despite tension, shows openness to dialogue.
Relays the promise to Mother that she will be fixed, conveying hope and trust.
Shouts 'GET OFF HER!' and tries to physically pull Jinn off Mother to protect her.
Kicks and thrashes as others hold him back, showing fierce concern and desperation for Mother's safety.
Pleading 'Please don’t do this! Please --' when others try to shut Mother down, showing emotional vulnerability and hope.
Prays quietly that Mother will be the one to walk out, indicating sincere hope and affection.
Falls silent and shows horror when Jinn emerges injured instead of Mother, reflecting deep emotional response and care.
Freezes up with shock witnessing the Cleric's head explosion and the sudden bloodshed.
Is dragged along by Marcus in panic, showing hesitation and confusion rather than taking initiative.
Reacts with horrified bafflement on learning about Mother's true identity, indicating difficulty processing critical information quickly.
Gasps but does not warn his captors about Mother's presence or danger.
Looks away in horror when Payen's hand explodes, showing discomfort and fear but no intervention.
Meets Mother's stare but then freezes and turns away horrified, indicating internal conflict rather than confrontation or support.
Stumbles away covering his ears from Mother’s siren blast, covering his eyes afterwards and avoiding looking at Mother.
Removes hands to see Mother walking off into the forest, showing some curiosity or awareness.
No direct actions or statements observed in this excerpt.
Sits crying in the cold, overwhelmed and unable to act when the ark crashes and danger looms.
Later sits quietly on his cot, helmet on, deep in thought and possibly reflecting on his situation.
Greets the girl cautiously but with concern, addresses her as 'Mother'
Orders the disturbing situation to stop ('Stop this, Mother') showing assertiveness to protect others
Reaches out physically to touch the new children, seeking to confirm their reality and offering silent reassurance
Notices the children are shivering and immediately offers to get them nightgear to help them
Does not show signs of distrust or fear toward the new children, instead shows wonder and acceptance
Recognizes new children entering the barracks, cautiously approaches them, and confirms their reality by physically touching them, showing curiosity and thoughtful hesitation.
Responds to the cold and the children's obvious distress by offering to get nightgear from the nursery promptly.
Appears confused and uncertain when asked if 'Mother' will kill the children, showing a lack of confident knowledge about the situation.

Works efficiently with a companion to remove a heavy steel crate from a damaged, tipping spacecraft, showing teamwork, physical strength, and problem-solving by redistributing weight to stop the craft from tipping.
Despite the precarious situation, maintains calmness and uses strength and coordination to hold onto the crate and with the companion, manages to pull both crate and self up from a bottomless hole.
Plays happily and laughs with peers in a group of children in nature.
Shares in collective grief silently with peers after the loss of a friend, sitting together respectfully with Mother teaching.
Notices and shows awareness of other children who are sick and vulnerable during a cold night.
Sits alone in the cold, crying, visibly upset and vulnerable.
Sits alone on his cot, lost in thought, possibly feeling abandoned or isolated.
Stands stunned watching Mother leave with the stolen Mitraic lander, unable to intervene or understand fully what is happening.
Maintains composure and attentive observation of Mother’s actions despite confusion.
